com.mobius.vdrapi
Class VersionIdFormatter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.mobius.vdrapi.VersionIdFormatter
public class VersionIdFormatter
extends Object

A class uses a VersionIdFormatter object to convert a version ID, which is by default rendered as a time-date string in the format YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, into a more 'user-friendly' format.

Note that VersionIdFormatter performs the reverse function of VersionDateTimeFormatter, which converts a user-friendly version ID into the generic YYYYMMDDHHMMSS format.

The following example shows how to use an instance of VersionIdFormatter:

String versionString = new VersionIdFormatter("19990520011934").getFormattedVersionId();
System.out.println (versionString);

Constructor Summary
VersionIdFormatter(String versionId)
          Creates a new VersionIdFormatter object.
VersionIdFormatter(String versionId, DateFormat dateFormat)
          Creates a new VersionIdFormatter object, with a DateFormat object that will be used to format the 'user-friendly' date time string.
 
Method Summary
static DateFormat getDefaultDateFormat()
          Returns the default DateFormat object that creates the formatting for the version IDs.
 String getFormattedVersionId()
          Returns the user-friendly formatted Version ID, with the actual format determined by the DateFormat object being used.
static void setDefaultDateFormat(DateFormat newFormat)
          Specifies the default DateFormat object used to create the formatting for the version IDs.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

VersionIdFormatter

public VersionIdFormatter(String versionId)
                   throws NumberFormatException
Creates a new VersionIdFormatter object. This constructor will assume that the 'user-friendly' format is the format specified by the default locale, or overridden through use of the setDefaultDateFormat class method.

Parameters:
versionId - the version date and time formatted in the generic YYYYMMDDHHMMSS format.
See Also:
setDefaultDateFormat(java.text.DateFormat), VersionIdFormatter(java.lang.String,java.text.DateFormat)

VersionIdFormatter

public VersionIdFormatter(String versionId,
                          DateFormat dateFormat)
                   throws NumberFormatException
Creates a new VersionIdFormatter object, with a DateFormat object that will be used to format the 'user-friendly' date time string.

Parameters:
versionId - the version date and time formatted in the generic YYYYMMDDHHMMSS format.
dateFormat - the DateFormat instance that specifies the 'user-friendly' format.
Method Detail

getDefaultDateFormat

public static DateFormat getDefaultDateFormat()
Returns the default DateFormat object that creates the formatting for the version IDs.

getFormattedVersionId

public String getFormattedVersionId()
Returns the user-friendly formatted Version ID, with the actual format determined by the DateFormat object being used.

See Also:
setDefaultDateFormat(java.text.DateFormat)

Specifies the default DateFormat object used to create the formatting for the version IDs.
